risk_factors.reasoning: Being an 18-year-old male does not necessarily indicate a higher risk of re-arrest.
Being White does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Having been arrested 10 times and convicted indicates a higher risk of re-arrest.
Being 6 feet 1 inch tall does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Weighing 195 lbs does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Being unmarried does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Having a GED certificate and not being enrolled in college indicates a lower risk of re-arrest.
Holding only one job during the year does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Using drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) indicates a higher risk of re-arrest.
Not feeling depressed over the past month does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
Living with both biological parents in an urban area with a household size of 4 at a young age indicates a higher risk of re-arrest.
Considering that God has something to do with what happens to him personally does not necessarily indicate a higher or lower risk of re-arrest.
